intro: Eutaxia reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined eutaxia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf venation patterns. The plant features slender, upright stems covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a prominent, net-like venation system that gives it its common name. Eutaxia reticulata produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer.
